text:
Welcome to How To Cook That I'm Ann Reardon 
and let's debunk some more videos from TikTok,

YouTube and across the internet! This first one 
was sent in to me by Rouille and she says I saw

a lot of people try to waffle iron marshmallows 
but they ended up burnt. I would love to know if

this can be achieved. Technically yes you should 
be able to melt a marshmallow and let it sit

and pick it up like that, it's going to be 
tricky on a waffle line but i'll give it a go

for you. If i put it on minimum heat and spray 
on a little cooking oil then add marshmallows,

my waffle machine is bigger than theirs so let's 
add four and then you can see that despite using

the oil the marshmallow has stuck to the waffle 
maker and trying to get it off the machine is a

frustratingly painful process 😡 it would be great 
if the parts of the machine that touched the food

could be removed so you could soak them but it 
can't ... so two hours later after trying to clean

it i made a batch of normal waffles to try and 
get all the little bits of marshmallow off. Normal

waffles are ideal for a waffle machine 👍🏻 okay 
attempt number two ... the waffle iron is really

well greased and on low and i'm just leaving 
it open so the marshmallow can slowly melt over

about three minutes because you'll notice in his 
video it was brown on the bottom and not the top.

Now i think that's looking pretty spread out so 
let's spray the top of the marshmallow with oil

and quickly press down just a little 
bit and a bit more oil and do it again.

That looks about right now if i try and pick 
that up now you can see melted marshmallow is

completely soft so there's no way you could pick 
it up like they did in their video so obviously

they've left it to cool completely before they 
got it off and even when i do that with all of

the oil it is still stuck! Ahh my waffle maker 
does have a more intricate pattern on it than

theirs does but this would have to be the worst 
method to do this, let's see what dave thinks?
Wow!
A waffle you say? 🧐
Ewwghch! (spellcheck?).
It's like greasy, sweet, yewch!

If you want that flavor of toasted 
marshmallows but you don't have a fire going

i've come up with a much 
easier method for you to use.

Put some non-stick baking paper on a sandwich 
press spray it very lightly with cooking oil

and add your marshmallows then let them melt 
until they look nice and golden on the bottom

then move that baking paper onto a cold piece of 
stone or a block of ice will do to rapidly cool it

so we can pick it up off the paper.
Looks like an egg minus the yolk.

That's pretty good bit like a s'mores. S'mores 
minus the biscuits don't need your own cookies

it's got a nice crispy outer shell and it's all 
gooey and yummy inside it's uh it's pretty good.

Next there is a new player bursting into the 
content farm baking space... Life Studio is

based in Vietnam and they are producing heaps 
and heaps of videos across lots of different

genres but today i'm just focusing on the baking 
ones like Sweet Storytime, Best Cake, Life Cake,

Kawaii Cake Storytime, Cake Story, Spirit Cake 
Story, My Cookie Storytime and Bella Cake Story

and don't be fooled by the thumbnails. This video 
does not have a giant dress cake, no lipstick cake

and no giant chocolate ball it's just donuts and 
freak shakes and no this one doesn't even mention

a giant car cake and this one is not about a 
giant dress cake. The cakes in the thumbnail

are pure clickbait. I've raised this issue with 
youtube in the past with content farms if the

thumbnail's not matching what the content is and 
surely that violates one of youtube's policies the

thumbnail policy here where it says misleading 
viewers into thinking they're about to view

something that's not in the video but the response 
from the policy team from YouTube was that it's on

the same topic so it's still cake so it's not 
really that misleading it's okay. So i'm really

glad that YouTube doesn't sell actual products 
because can you imagine if you ordered a life-size

3D car cake and then you got this cake and if you 
complained they would say well you ordered a cake

and you got a cake so it wasn't misleading at all
😝. I think we have different understandings of

what misleading is but anyway the reason i bought 
these channels to your attention was not the

thumbnails, it was actually a totally different 
reason ... if parents are letting their kids watch

these channels and they have headphones on they 
might think that they're just watching videos that

are decorating videos to music but in reality 
you're letting Life Studio make up stories and

tell them to your kids. I want to tell you how 
i was held hostage by a crazy guy and i just

couldn't get away ... i'm going to tell you 
a really crazy story of how a student of mine

tried to make a move on me ... and 
while some of them are very unrealistic

like a girl on her way to school they drop into 
the shops she accidentally knocks a gun out of a

robber's hand who turns out to be a wanted serial 
killer who's escaped from jail ... give me my gun

the robber screamed and lunged at me my heart was 
pounding so hard in my chest as i dodged him. I

then aimed the gun towards him in an awkward way 
he raised both of his hands up and surrendered

it was a fantastic experience but the thought of 
being late in my first class was distracting me.

Yeah i'm pretty sure after that experience you 
don't just worry about getting to school on time

you'd probably have the day off and most people 
don't describe being held up at gunpoint as a

fantastic experience but anyway i assume they're 
just supposed to be kids stories and not realistic

at all but then again they're not really stories i 
would want kids to listen to. Most of the stories

it is a school-aged child usually a girl who 
is the main character in the story but they're

usually from a neglectful or abusive home life. 
She looked at me with burning eyes and she started

approaching me with the chair still in her hands 
i immediately hid in my closet right before my mom

took the last swing that was meant for me but it 
hit the ground and the chair broke apart. In other

ones both the parents die in car accidents and 
in still others the dad is really angry with a

girl's boyfriend for stealing some of her money so 
this is his response ... my dad pulled him inside

and threw him on the couch. Valery go upstairs 
and get your swimsuits he said i did as he asked

my dad then forced Aiden to wear them and took 
many pictures. He forced Aiden to upload them

to his own instagram page! I don't know what 
the laws are in Vietnam but here in Australia

if an adult did that to a child you'd be up on 
criminal charges. That's just creepy! And if your

kids have been watching these channels you might 
need to re-educate them about stranger danger.

Someone knocked on the front door i opened it 
and saw a strange tiny man standing there with

a creepy smile on his face and he smells really 
good he said hi i'm Noah i'm looking for your dad

is he home i replied no he's out there looking 
for a stupid job. I was about to close the door

in his face when he suddenly pushed it back open 
i screamed i thought he was going to hurt me he

took off his glasses and told me to stay calm he 
looked a lot less intimidating without his glasses

on and his face was softer i said okay come on in.
For any kids watching if you do happen to be home

alone do not answer the door at all and if you 
did you would never let a stranger in to your home

that is not a good idea and despite what you hear 
in this next story you should never ever meet up

with someone who you have met in an online forum.
After one of my live youtube videos one of my

viewers sent a message asking if we could meet it 
was a bit strange for someone to be so insistent

especially after what my brother was doing so 
i ignored him at first then a few days later he

messaged me again he said he knew how to deal with 
my brother he believed me i agreed to meet him but

i was nervous what if it's just a stupid prank i 
wondered i went to the coffee shop he had asked

me to go to i didn't even know his name. And in 
that story he turns out to be a handsome knight

in shining armour who rescues her from all her 
troubled home life problems. That is not how that

story normally ends if someone is pressuring you 
and wants to meet you you need to tell a trusted

adult if you can't tell your parents find another 
trusted adult in your life to tell about that

do not ever meet someone from online on your 
own, not safe not okay! 🎈 So cakes have gone from

how to videos where people explain how to make 
a cake to fast-forwarded videos to music now to

fast-forwarded videos with creepy stories over 
the top! I cannot predict what will be next on

this platform it is a bit crazy. This next one was 
sent into me by Andrew asking is this legit? They

put an egg in a bowl with some sprite and add some 
red skittles then they cover it and 24 hours later

there's a red blob inside a transparent egg. Let's 
do it ... egg with sprite red skittles lid on 24

hours later and ta-da the skittles are inside 
the egg! 😲 No not really ... these are balls

of play-doh that i made inside a spherical of 
water. I'm pretty sure the original video just

had a toy this one is much more fragile 😳 So what 
really happens if you put sprite and skittles in

a bowl with eggs? All the colour dissolves off 
the skittles turning the sprite a reddish hue

and the bubbles in weak acid in the drink 
start to affect the outer layer of the eggshell

and 24 hours later...
🥁

The eggshell looks blistered and if you rub 
it you can kind of rub off the outer layer

of the eggshell, it's pretty gross and the 
original was definitely a fake I'm pretty

sure that one was a joke. Speaking of fake 
content though someone posted a pirated copy

of my book onto Amazon this is 
not my book this is a weird little

mixture of stuff that i'm pretty sure was 
written by artificial intelligence because

it doesn't even make sense ... it says "butter 
is the fundamental fixing in this batter formula

you will work it straight forwardly into 
the flour framing pea size disintegrates".

That's the sort of thing that's in here this is 
definitely not my book and a big thank you to Alia

from Amazon who helped us get that taken down so 
that you don't get that anymore. This is my book

this is what my book actually looks like i 
took a year writing it it has beautiful recipes

that have all been tested and triple-tested and 
worked beautifully and lovely photos throughout

this is what you want to get. Now you can get this 
through Amazon now the official one has been there

all along but the pirated one is now gone you 
can also get it through bookstores. If you're in

Australia you can actually get a signed copy sent 
directly from us if you order through our website

and people from America and Canada have seen that 
link and gone how come we can't get signed copies

sent from you? And the reason is postage from 
Australia is absolutely ridiculously expensive

it would just not be worth your while. So what i 
have done for you because it's nearly Christmas,

I signed a bunch of book plates and sent them off 
to my publisher Mango and so if you're in the U.S

or Canada you can order directly from their 
website i'll put a link to that below and get

a copy of the book with a signed bookplate. 
Next we have a lady on TikTok who says this

is how you wash your chicken before you cook it: 
this time my grandma showed me my mama showed me

this is how i do it for me so you're going to put 
it a little bit of chlorox they have to be named

brand chlorox, bleach oil will not taste right 
once you put your chlorox you're going to take

a little bit i mean maybe about two drops of the 
Dawn detergent don't put a lot that's people mess

up that you only need two drops to the water look 
a little bit hazy that means the chicken is now

clean. Then you're gonna rinse it right here my 
chicken stock going down my drainage i had to

bring it back up because it was going down and 
i could not lose my chicken because i only got

a little bit so once i got all my chicken back to 
the top of course i go ahead and hit a little bit

of water rinse it off and then once i rinse it off 
i'm going to go ahead and now start the seasoning.

Where do i start with that one there was so much 
wrong with it let's begin with letting the chicken

fall down the garbage disposal unit and then 
pulling it out! How many germs are you going to

get on it from doing that that's just oh not good, 
secondly using bleach on your food to clean it no

bleach is not supposed to be ingested 
bleach is an irritant to your mouth and

your gastrointestinal tract and your skin that 
should not be used on your food please don't

copy that, not a good idea. Now where does that 
come from most people are washing their chicken

and going to the extremes of using things like 
bleach because they think they need to kill the

bacteria on the chicken but the thing that kills 
the bacteria on the chicken is not washing it

it's cooking it. So you have to cook your chicken 
really well and that will take care of all the

bacteria that will kill the bacteria even washing 
it with bleach is not going to kill the bacteria

bleach needs to be in contact with the bacteria 
for 10 minutes before it's going to be effective.

So research has actually shown that people who 
wash their chicken in their sink are actually

more likely to get food poisoning because they're 
spreading bacteria all around their kitchen which

this video illustrates beautifully. If we watch 
it again you can see this still has bacteria on it

now her gloves have bacteria on it and she touches 
the detergent bottle so that's now contaminated

then she touches the tap so that also has 
bacteria on it and now the top of the spice

bottle and all the other spices too and of course 
the sink itself has bacteria on it too. With that

level of contamination all over your kitchen 
it's very easy then for bacteria to get onto

food that's not going to be baked like a salad 
or something else that you could ingest which

could give you food poisoning and make you sick. 
So make sure when you cook your chicken you bake

it really well to kill all the bacteria and try 
not to spread the bacteria all over your kitchen

before you get it into the oven or the fry pan.
From there on to the headlines that say Facebook

gave the angry emoji five times the value of 
a like. Now while that headline is actually

true it's kind of deceptive because at the time 
when facebook introduced all the different emojis

that you could respond to posts with they gave 
all the emojis the value of five times a like,

so that wasn't so much an issue what the issue 
was that after a year or so the data scientists

started to note a pattern which was the 😠 the 
😲 and the 😂 emojis when they were used a lot on

posts those posts seemed to be the ones that 
contained a lot of misinformation or hateful

content and basically bad posts for people to 
be exposed to. When they knew that information

they didn't demote the power of those emojis which 
would have meant those posts weren't seen as much,

they just kept it how it was! They have done 
so now apparently but they've demoted the

power of all the emojis. Facebook as well 
as most businesses will do experiments and

run experiments to see what is going to work for 
them what is going to make the most profit what is

going to be best but because Facebook has 
access to so much of your data and so much

of your interactions you might be surprised 
at how personal some of these experiments get.

For example they did one experiment testing 
what if we show you all negative posts

in your feed versus if we show you all positive 
posts in your feed and we do that for a whole week

after the week the posts that you then write 
yourself are they going to be mainly negative

or are they going to be mainly positive? And 
they found that in fact it was true they could

manipulate your emotions ... if they showed you 
positive things you wrote positive posts if they

showed you mainly negative things after a week 
you were writing negative posts! Interestingly

most of these sort of studies or psychological 
studies would be carried out by a university

and universities have very strict rules whenever 
you're doing human studies including psychological

ones The volunteers have to give their consent 
to be part of it and they have to have informed

consent they need to know the positives and 
the negatives of being part of the study,

they need to be able to pull out at any time 
and they should be debriefed at the end of the

study to make sure there's no harm caused to 
the volunteers. But in this case Facebook is

not a university they're a private company so they 
are not bound by any of those rules and in their

terms and conditions which you agreed to when you 
made a Facebook account it says here we use the

information that we have including from research 
partners that we collaborate with to conduct

and support research and innovation on topics of 
general social welfare, technological advancement,

public interest health and well-being and the 
interesting thing again is most universities will

do these studies in order to find out what is good 
for people and then people use that research to

change policies and do things which are going to 
make things better for people but in this case the

main aim is not to do better by you but to do 
better by the shareholders 🤑 During my time at

Facebook first working as the lead product manager 
for civic misinformation and later on counter

espionage i saw Facebook repeatedly encounter 
conflicts between its own profits and our safety.

Facebook consistently resolved these conflicts in 
favour of its own profits! We need some sort of

rules or regulation in these sort of forums 
to make sure that things that cause harm to

people shouldn't be allowed and we understand the 
difficulty there of only the people within the

company have this information so they can just 
keep it all secret and we don't even know that

they know that it's causing harm and that they're 
making decisions over that so very interesting

topic if you want to look into that more you 
can watch that full video of the testimony

that she gave and i'll link to that below. On a 
lighter note lots of people sent me this video

"Cake in One Minute you'll be making this cake 
every day" ... it's a nice enough video when

you look at it but the reason it was sent to me 
obviously is because it takes longer than a minute

to make even in the video and if i skip forward 
you can see it needs to bake for 35 to 40 minutes.

If we click through to the channel this 
one minute cake has 6.3 million views

but this one over here with a very similar 
thumbnail and content only has 66000 views or 1

of the views because it says it takes 15 
minutes. The youtube algorithm favours

things that have a high click-through rate 
and i don't think that's a good idea because

then people have to resort to clickbait and 
it's hard to do clickbait with baking videos

this one has worked for him so i'm sure we'll 
see a lot more videos that say in one minute.

Obviously this is going to take more than 
a minute but let me time it for you...

Even if i don't include the time it took 
me to weigh out the ingredients and if i

really rush and make a bit of a 
mess here i can get it in the oven

in four minutes and that included chopping all 
the apples. So it's a fairly simple recipe.

A one minute apple cake is 
that, it took you one minute?

A little bit longer.
Incredible.

If i had 60 seconds to spare 
i'd cook that, not bad.

So yes it was clickbait but it was easy to 
make and it tasted good so go give Max some

more views and try out his recipe it's the only 
one of his videos that's gone viral for him.

Next let me tell you about today's sponsor 
KiwiCo. They make crates that are themed in

science technology engineering art and maths 
for all different ages and they've just added

a new one called Yummy Crate. Each Yummy Crate 
comes with a gadget and instructions for a food

science experiment. This one was all about the 
Maillard Reaction when you heat food there's a

chemical reaction that happens that causes it 
to brown and get that yummy flavor and smell.

Each crate also has a folder with three recipe 
cards that go with the theme of the crate.

You will need to go to the shops to get the 
ingredients they can't ship those to you in the

crate but shopping for them yourself allows you 
to substitute things out if you have any dietary

needs or preferences and then you can start 
cooking. This is a great family activity the

recipes have all been tested by KiwiCo and they've 
tested them with kids checking that they work

so it will help build up your kids' confidence in 
the kitchen. Look at that! Delicious Delicious.

There's even a magazine with more 
information which is great for home learning.

I'll put a link in the description below where 
you can get 50% off your first Yummy Crate.

Now on to a recipe that says it is a 
two ingredient no-bake chocolate cookie,

no flour eggs butter or oil. Emily sent this 
link to me asking if this recipe would work.

Well basically it is just cocoa powder and 
maple syrup mixed together to make a paste.

I did need to use a lot more maple syrup than the 
recipe said you needed by weight but if you add

enough and you keep stirring you can make them 
into balls and then squash it down to make them

look like cookies but you don't bake 
them and they're actually not cookies.
Hmmm, is it cooked?

No.
An oven was

the third ingredient was it? A bridge too far.

It couldn't make it any worse.
Next Blossom is into the food hacks again

they're putting sweetened condensed milk into 
a jar and then microwaving it for five minutes

to get easy caramel that you can pour on your 
ice cream. That is not how life works this is

not going to happen like that but let me show 
you. I've got my jar and my sweet and condensed

milk don't you just love how sweet and condensed 
milk pours and makes little ribbons as it goes in.

Now let me microwave that, we are at a minute and 
a half here and it's starting to overflow and it

is not caramelized yet two and a half minutes 
and this is really making a mess that i'm not

looking forward to cleaning but it's still not 
caramel. Three and a half minutes and it's no

longer overflowing because there's hardly anything 
left in the jar to overflow and at four and a half

minutes it's finally starting to caramelise on 
the thin bits around the top of the jar and at

five minutes it looks like this. Way too hot 
to handle 🔥 I'll have to let that cool before

we can take it out it's definitely not the 
instant caramel topping that was promised.

I assume it wasn't meant to look like this. You 
definitely couldn't pour that on your ice cream

it looks like a decorative jar that you'd get at 
some sort of craft festival ... only stickier.

Oh no.

can explode causing hot water to splash up and 
go all over you causing burns usually to the face

and the torso and there's been plenty 
of news stories about that happening.

Well there were lots of people who wrote in the

cooking eggs poached eggs and a microwave

or gory things look away now because

yeah fair warning okay but yeah. It's a bit

but i would suggest don't poach your eggs in the
